lines.text: The misfortunes of war!

[to Ann while undressing]
Do you mind?... I'm a bit shy.
Do we run or fight?
We don't have a choice now.
Damn right!

[On the phone]
This is Braddock. I'll go.
Colonel James Braddock
Ah, Colonel Braddock. I heard much about you. Welcome to the People's Republic of Vietnam.
[Offers a handshake but Braddock ignores him and stares at him]
Colonel! You are a goddamn embarrasment, Braddock.
That's why I'm here, senator.
Colonel Braddock, is it not true that during the war there was a price on your head of 5,000 American Dollars?
It was more like 20,000. Why don't you tell us why there was a price on my head?
For your war crimes, of course.
For killing assholes like you!
I'm looking for Jack Tucker, is he around?
He'll be here in a moment.
[Tucker falls from over the railing in the second floor, onto a table and smashes it]
Thanks. How's it going, Tuck?
Braddock, what the hell are you doing here?
I wanna rent your boat. It's important, how much?

[Tucker replies while fighting goons]
Five grand... four grand...
I didn't hear ya.
Two...
Did you say one thousand?
No... yeah, thousand bucks.
That's what I thought you said. Come on!
